etymologies: Middle English (probably existing, although not recorded, in Old English); probably of Germanic origin and related to Norwegian kutte and Icelandic kuta ‘cut with a small knife’, kuti ‘small blunt knife’

definitions: make an opening, incision, or wound in (something) with a sharp-edged tool or object

examples.text: he cut his toe on a sharp stone
when fruit is cut open, it turns brown
the pain in her voice cut him deeply
Lou's wit could cut like a knife
she had a cut finger

definitions: make a deliberate incision in (one's flesh), as a symptom of psychological or emotional distress

examples.text: I started cutting myself when I was about 14 and continued for four years
I just started high school and I have a lot of self-confidence issues and as a result I started cutting

shortDefinitions: make incision in one's own flesh, as symptom of psychological or emotional distress

definitions: castrate (an animal, especially a horse).
circumcise (a boy or man).
divide into pieces with a knife or other sharp implement

examples.text: cut the beef into thin slices

definitions: make divisions in (something)

examples.text: the country was cut into three parts

definitions: separate (something) into two pieces; sever

examples.text: they cut the rope before he choked

definitions: remove (something) from something larger by using a sharp implement

examples.text: bacon was cut from the joints that hung from the ceiling
cut away the unwanted sections by running the knife under them

definitions: make or form (something) by using a sharp tool to remove material

examples.text: workmen cut a hole in the pipe
she stared at the lettering cut into the stonework

definitions: make or design (a garment) in a particular way

examples.text: Madame Vionnet was the first to cut a dress on the bias, in 1927
an impeccably cut suit

definitions: make (a path, tunnel, or other route) by excavation, digging, or chopping

examples.text: it took engineers a dozen years and the federal government $500 million to cut a road through the canyon
investigators called for a machete to cut through the bush

definitions: produce (a vinyl record) from a sound recording

examples.text: quadraphonic LPs had to be cut at a lower volume level than conventional records

definitions: trim or reduce the length of (grass, hair, etc.) by using a sharp implement

examples.text: Ted was cutting the lawn
they cut back the growth closest to the tree

definitions: reduce the size, amount, or quantity of

examples.text: buyers will bargain hard to cut the cost of the house they want
advocates of reform say more must be done to cut crime

definitions: shorten (a text, film, or performance) by removing material

examples.text: he had to cut unnecessary additions made to the opening scene

definitions: delete (part of a text or other display) so as to insert a copy of it elsewhere.
absent oneself from (something one should normally attend, especially school)

examples.text: Robert was cutting class

definitions: end or interrupt the provision of (a supply)

examples.text: we resolved to cut oil supplies to territories controlled by the rebels
if the pump develops a fault, the electrical supply is immediately cut

definitions: switch off (an engine or a light)

examples.text: Niall brought the car to a halt and cut the engine

definitions: (of a line) cross or intersect (another line)

examples.text: mark the point where the line cuts the vertical axis

definitions: stop filming or recording

examples.text: ‘Cut’ shouted a voice, followed by ‘Could we do it again, please?’

definitions: move to another shot in a film

examples.text: cut to a dentist's surgery
the way the director cuts from shot to shot has an impact

definitions: make (a film) into a coherent whole by removing parts or placing them in a different order

examples.text: I like to watch the rushes at home before I start cutting the film

definitions: mix (an illegal drug) with another substance

examples.text: dealers cut the drugs to stretch their supply
police say it's likely the cocaine was cut with fentanyl

definitions: strike or kick (a ball) with an abrupt, typically downward motion

examples.text: Cook cut the ball back to him

definitions: slice (the ball).
hit (the ball) to the off side with the bat held almost horizontally; play such a stroke against (the bowler).
shortDefinitions: hit ball to off side with horizontal bat

definitions: (of the ball) turn sharply on pitching.
divide a pack of playing cards by lifting a portion from the top, either to reveal a card at random or to place the top portion under the bottom portion

examples.text: let's cut for dealer

definitions: ignore or refuse to recognize (someone)

examples.text: they cut her in public

phrases.text: cut someone down in their prime
cut your coat according to your cloth

definitions: a stroke or blow given by a sharp-edged implement or by a whip or cane

examples.text: he could skin an animal with a single cut of the knife

definitions: a haircut

examples.text: his hair was in need of a cut

definitions: a reduction in amount or size

examples.text: she took a 20% pay cut
a cut in interest rates

definitions: a power cut

examples.text: fortunately the cut happened at night and power was quickly restored

definitions: an act of cutting part of a book, play, etc.

examples.text: they would not publish the book unless the author was willing to make cuts

definitions: an immediate transition from one scene to another in a film

examples.text: instead of hard cuts, we used dissolves to give it a very dreamy character

definitions: the halfway point of a golf tournament, where half of the players are eliminated.
a stroke made with an abrupt, typically horizontal or downward action

examples.text: Kellett was denied a century by edging a cut to wicketkeeper Burns

definitions: a long, narrow incision in the skin made by something sharp

examples.text: blood ran from a cut on his jaw

definitions: a long, narrow opening or incision made in a surface or piece of material

examples.text: make a single cut along the top of each potato

definitions: a piece of meat cut from a carcass

examples.text: a good lean cut of beef

definitions: a share of the profits from something

examples.text: the directors are demanding their cut

definitions: a recording of a piece of music

examples.text: a cut from his forthcoming album

definitions: a version of a film after editing

examples.text: the final cut

definitions: a passage cut or dug out, as a railway cutting or a new channel made for a river or other waterway

examples.text: the cut connected with the Harborough arm of the canal

definitions: a wounding remark or act

examples.text: his unkindest cut at Elizabeth was to call her heartless

definitions: the way or style in which something, especially a garment or someone's hair, is cut

examples.text: the elegant cut of his dinner jacket

phrases.text: cut someone down in their prime
cut your coat according to your cloth
